etymologies: late 16th century: from French, from Spanish almártaga, from Arabic al-marta‘a ‘the fastening’, influenced by martingale, from Occitan martegal ‘inhabitant of Martigues (in Provence’)

definitions: a strap, or set of straps, attached at one end to the noseband (standing martingale) or reins (running martingale) of a horse and at the other end to the girth. It is used to prevent the horse from raising its head too high.
shortDefinitions: strap or set of straps running from noseband or reins to girth of horse

definitions: a gambling system of continually doubling the stakes in the hope of an eventual win that must yield a net profit.
shortDefinitions: gambling system of continually doubling stakes in hope of eventual win that must yield net profit
